meanings.definition: Totalists: Those who advocate for complete control or authority.
meanings.sent1: The totalists in the group always want to make decisions for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The totalists at the meeting pushed for strict rules to be followed by all.
meanings.sent3: The totalists decided that everyone should wear the same color shirt every day.
meanings.sent4: The totalists' influence was like a heavy blanket, smothering any opposing ideas.
meanings.sent5: The totalists' desire for control was as strong as a giant magnet pulling everything towards it.

meanings.definition: Totalists: Belonging to or characteristic of a group that seeks to impose its beliefs on others.
meanings.sent1: Her totalists views made her unpopular among those who valued individuality.
meanings.sent2: The totalists behavior of the group made it hard for others to express different opinions.
meanings.sent3: The totalists' fashion sense involved everyone wearing the same hat every day.
meanings.sent4: The totalists' influence was like a loudspeaker drowning out all other voices.
meanings.sent5: The totalists' attitude was as forceful as a strong wind blowing in one direction.

meanings.definition: Totalists: A person who believes in or supports a totalitarian system of government.
meanings.sent1: The totalists in the country wanted a government with complete control over everything.
meanings.sent2: The totalists' loyalty to the dictator was unwavering.
meanings.sent3: The totalists' idea of fun was everyone following the same strict routine.
meanings.sent4: The totalists' power was like a giant shadow looming over the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The totalists' vision for the country was as clear as a bright light illuminating the path forward.
